meanings.definition: A principle or standard by which something may be judged or decided.
meanings.sent1: The teacher used specific criteria to grade the students' essays.
meanings.sent2: The hiring manager had a set of criteria to assess job applicants.
meanings.sent3: The criteria for choosing a movie to watch were based on the length and genre.
meanings.sent4: Her criteria for a perfect vacation included beautiful beaches and delicious food.
meanings.sent5: The strict criteria for passing the exam made it challenging for many students.

meanings.definition: A rule or principle for evaluating or testing something.
meanings.sent1: The scientist followed strict criteria when conducting the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The criteria for selecting the winner were clearly outlined in the competition rules.
meanings.sent3: The criteria for winning the game involved scoring the most points.
meanings.sent4: His criteria for success in business were based on hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent5: The safety criteria for building a new bridge were carefully reviewed by the engineers.
